assetshandler

Class AssetsSaver

  • java.lang.Object
    • assetshandler.AssetsSaver

  • public class AssetsSaver
extends java.lang.Object
    A class with purely static methods for the purposes of saving assets (Species, FoodTypes and ToyTypes) to a file.
    Author:
    Alex Tompkins (ato47)

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      AssetsSaver()

      static void writeAssetsToFile(java.io.File folder, Species[] species, FoodType[] foodTypes, ToyType[] toyTypes)
      Writes all assets (both defaults and user-defined) to a given folder, along with their ImageIcons.

        equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

    • Method Detail

      • writeAssetsToFile

        public static void writeAssetsToFile(java.io.File folder,
                                     Species[] species,
                                     FoodType[] foodTypes,
                                     ToyType[] toyTypes)
                              throws java.io.IOException
        Writes all assets (both defaults and user-defined) to a given folder, along with their ImageIcons.
        Parameters:
        folder - The File object representing the folder to save to.
        species - The array of Species to write to the folder.
        foodTypes - The array of FoodTypes to write to the folder.
        toyTypes - The array of ToyTypes to write to the folder.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - May throw IOException if the buffered output stream is interrupted when writing or closing itself, or if the program is unable to make the folders it needs to.
